name: Castle Hokele Suites Waikiki

reviews.title: Value & Location
reviews.text: Property was fine. Great location in the center of Waikiki at a great price. Older property with some recent upgrades. Bathrooms need a lot of work. Parking very limited. Kids loved the pool. Staff friendly.

reviews.title: Do not stay here and expect clean showers!
reviews.text: We stayed here our first night in Hawaii, and we did not feel that the showers were clean at all. We did not use any of the antiquated "aminities", and you would not want to either. We spent the next night out on the beach, with more satisfaction. Check out home stays else where on the island before you book this place.

reviews.title: Dont Stay Here!!!
reviews.text: DONT STAY HERE!!!!

reviews.title: It was alrightt....
reviews.text: We were lied to and didnt recieve bonus items (such as vouchers, a free in-room safe) that we were meant to get with our room etc.

reviews.title: Marc Suites Waikiki was disgusting
reviews.text: Most of the staff were rude and horibile and were not willing to help or assist us in any way possible. Our toilet flooded and it took them three days to fix it. We had to basically beg for an alternate room to sleep in at night. The refrigerator was also broken and so much of our food went off.

reviews.title: OK, But Just OK
reviews.text: The carpet was stained, the room a bit tattered as a whole, but decent for the money.

reviews.title: Not Impressed
reviews.text: Our room was dirty, we arrived only to find the sheets were filthy dirty, the shower had paint peeling, and the shower door had mold. We arrived at 10pm, the clerk treated us as though we were bothering him. The next day we complained about the room, we were offered another room but had to wait 5 days for it, they were sold out. I was caught off guard on check in when they asked for ID's from everyone over 18..by saturday night we figured out why, there were some ladies of the evening hanging around the hotel. we managed to stay one night at hickam, hale koa was sold out. we checked out on wednesday after we found lodging at another hotel. I don't go to hawaii to hang out in a room, but I do expect clean and comfortable and security at the very least when I return to my room to rest..

OK, it's not the Sheraton or the Meriott, but it was sufficient. The biggest drawback as far as aesthetics is concerned is that it is old. The one review that you will read about dirty bathrooms is actually incorrect. The tile in the showers has been resurfaced and is peeling, not dirty. The drapes were new, as was the upholstery on the sofa and dinette chairs. It was, as I said, ok. My only complaint is that the walls are thin; one of our neighbors, whose room adjoined our bedroom, had children who were up at the crack of dawn wanting water and cartoons. This was unpleasant. On the upside, I found the staff courteous and ready to help. As far as the room is concerned, you don't go to Hawaii, at least we didn't, to spend time in your room.
reviews.title: hotel ok
Should be downgraded to a motel
reviews.text: This place is pitiful. Do not stay there. Ever. Unless you're homeless. Even then the street may be more welcoming. Below are several reasons why we did not like the hotel:

reviews.title: Not bad, not great
reviews.text: o the bathrooms are puny: the sink is not large enough so you have to lean forward, however, leaning forward causes your head to smash into the mirror... see a problem?

reviews.title: A good hotel
reviews.text: I just got home after 3 nights at the Hokele in Waikiki. (Formerly the Marc Suites) I was with 3 other guys. Not a single problem. I had read some bad comments on this site before I left , & I was a little worried. The location was perfect!! Close to everything, and a 5 minute walk to the beach. The room was fine. It is not deluxe, but it had everything that we needed. The air condition was great and we had it in each room. We rented the 2 bedroom suite. The place was clean, and the staff were excellent. The front desk staff even held all of our luggage and golf bags ( 8 bags in total) after we checked out, because our flight wasnt until 10pm. I would stay there again for sure. Like I said, there are nicer places, but if all you do is sleep in the room, then who cares about the "bells and whistels" It was very clean.

reviews.title: Ok if you want a cheap place
reviews.text: The rooms were crap, the showers were a cave, the hot water broke down at least 3 times while we were there, remote controls were not working, the air-conditioners didnt function properly and leaked water all over the balcony which made the balcony really slippery.
This hotel is filthy is infested with large brown cockaroaches
reviews.title: Filthy Hotel And Rotten Service>

reviews.text: the staff is very rud they charge you $20.00dls per day for parking
reviews.title: A pleasant surprise

likes.liked: — Quiet location, close to everything in Waikiki
likes.disliked: — Lack of privacy due to surrounding apartments/hotels... but common in Waikiki wherever you stay

reviews.text: the hotels is very old smells bad the plumbing is very bad .we stayed there for one week and our room was not claned once our beds were not changed at all. we had to ask for shampoo and soap and towels this that most horrible experience that my family and I ever had. I will never ever even consider stay in that hotel. I don't know how hotels . com and expedia esponsor such a filthy hotel. hotels . com advertises that they know hotels in and out wich is false.
reviews.title: Old, but convenient

reviews.text: By the way we stayed in room # 435 if you ever go and stay there do not get that room is very FILTHY.
reviews.title: A most disappointing experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you Nick Carreno
reviews.title: This place sucks horribly !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
was good on this trip to Oahu
reviews.text: ok, check in is at 3pm and check out is at 12pm....we got in waaay too early and ended up sleeping on the couchs by the pool.

the hotel is good, as long as you get the right rooms........you dont want a room by a room that has 2 rooms...the connecting door is VERY THIN!! and the rooms toward "Seaside Ave" will most likely have baad lanai doors.....the room you want is directly overlooking the pool from your lanai door.
reviews.title: Close, Clean and reasonably Priced

reviews.text: all rooms have a fridge,coffee maker, hair dryer, tv, microwave, range/oven...the rooms most likely to have bugs or insects are toward seaside ave...
reviews.title: It's not the Ritz
Hell in Waikiki
reviews.text: When we put dirty towels on the floor for replacement, as per the hotel's instructions, we only occasionally got fresh towels etc. We had to specifically ask the maid for toilet paper, she did not refill herself. This hotel is just not the right place to get a stomach problem! It goes without saying that we did not get any soap or shampoo refills either...

reviews.title: i liked staying here.
reviews.text: Our 4th floor room was directly facing some flats just a few yards away, meaning that we could not have any privacy except when closing the curtains. We felt we had to be properly dressed before having breakfast on the balcony, or just to go out there. Furthermore, this is certainly not the view you expect when you travel all the way from Europe to see beautiful Hawaii!

reviews.title: Clean & Great Location
reviews.text: When we went to the front desk to complain about the quality we were told that we could be upgraded for USD 45 extra per night. We told the clerk that all we wanted was the same standard as the rest of our party had got and that we had all paid the same price. We were advised to see the manager the next day between 9 AM and 5 PM. We came to see the manager at 1 PM, but very conveniently he had "just gone out". And now the price for an upgrade had suddenly risen to USD 100!!!

reviews.title: Don't Stay There!!!!!!!!
reviews.text: I just got back from a trip to Honolulu over New Years Eve. I booked three rooms and our group stayed at the Hokele Suites for 7 nights. I was very disappointed with the quality of the rooms. The hotel needs to be completely renovated!!! Everything in the lobby and inside of the rooms are old and outdated. The showers are very nasty and filled with mildew and tiles that are falling off. (one of the shower doors was falling off the hinges). The beds are hard, the carpets are old and stained, and I did not enjoy our stay at this hotel. The hotel was so dirty I didn't even feel like sitting around the pool area. Luckily I didn't spend much time at this hotel (more like a motel) and I enjoyed spending my time in Oahu. I will never stay at any Castle Resort Property ever again!

aka: Castle Hokele Suites Waikiki Hotel Honolulu
description: Conveniently located in central Waikiki this 10-story hotel features air-conditioned suites, each with a fully equipped kitchen and a lanai. Close to restaurants, shops, and attractions and just three blocks from Waikiki Beach and the International Marketplace.
